image.altText: A pile of groceries alongside a cardboard box that reads: FOOD BANK

props.synopsis: A new report from Foodbank finds 20 per cent of Australian households have skipped meals or whole days of eating in the year up to July 2025.

title.children: One in five Australian households are 'severely food insecure', report finds

image.altText: A man looks at his award.

props.synopsis: From a dedicated doctor and a rubbish warrior, to a local hero who stopped a knife attack and helped fight Black Summer fires, the 2026 Northern Territory Australian of the Year awards are spotlighting local legends.

title.children: Doctor and dedicated volunteer named NT's Australian of the Year

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses with glitter up their cheekbones.

props.synopsis: For the LGBTQIA+ community, queer pubs and clubs can be an oasis. But in some capital cities they are vanishing.

title.children: By the end of the year, three capital cities could have no queer clubs

image.altText: A close-up of a locked gate inside a prison.

props.synopsis: A 56-year-old man was stripped naked, handcuffed and made to wear a spit hood after suffering a seizure inside prison, a coronial inquest into his death has heard.

title.children: Prisoner stripped naked, made to wear spit hood after seizure, court hears

image.altText: Dark grey clouds in the distance. Road to the right and grass, trees and hill to left.

props.synopsis: A severe thunderstorm brought down trees and cut power for several hours in Alice Springs.

title.children: Power restored after Alice Springs lashed by 'fierce' storm

image.altText: A pregnant woman standing alongside two mums holding their babies, all three women are wearing serious facial expressions.

props.synopsis: Women who have had traumatic birth experiences at Royal Darwin Hospital have gathered to share their stories and call for urgent action from the territory and federal governments.

title.children: 'It shouldn't be about luck': These women fear giving birth again in the NT

image.altText: Aerial of processing facility surrounded by green grass

props.synopsis: The sale of Yeeda Pastoral Company, including the Kimberley Meat Company, to TLP4 Australian Holdings is now complete.

title.children: Northern abattoirs set to return after Yeeda sale

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence.

props.synopsis: As incarceration rates continue to soar in the Northern Territory, experts say mental health reform in the justice system is crucial for improving community safety in the long term.

title.children: Doctors warn mental health reforms needed to keep children out of prison

image.altText: NT Police insignia on mud-splattered car door.

props.synopsis: An 11-year-old boy has died in a quad bike crash that also injured a 38-year-old man at a mango farm south of Darwin.

title.children: Boy, 11, dies in mango farm quad bike crash south of Darwin

image.altText: A close up of colourful Gazania plants on the roadside.

props.synopsis: The colourful flowers of gazanias might attract you to buy them at a nursery but it is worth considering whether you are getting an invasive weed causing havoc to our landscapes.

title.children: Flower likened to 'cancer' for environment still sold at nurseries

image.altText: Graphic with a lightbulb, logo of Temu, Commbank and HCF on a dynamic blue background.

props.synopsis: Five companies have been handed the infamous annual award by consumer group Choice, in a bid to name and shame "dodgy products, services and companies".

title.children: The five 'shonkiest' products and companies named in annual Choice awards

image.altText: Two people on a motion-blurred city street with a temple and spire. Overlay "Race Around the World"

props.synopsis: Cult '90s show Race Around the World is back, and we're on the hunt for fearless storytellers! Got a passport, an epic sense of adventure and an eye for a story? We want to hear from you.

title.children: This career-making travel show is making a comeback and casting is open

image.altText: A white SUV stacked on top of a blue 4WD in flooding debris and rubbled next to homes as one man tries to walk away

props.synopsis: More than 50 people are dead and hundreds of thousands displaced after rains from Typhoon Kalmaegi flooded the central Philippines, sweeping away trucks and shipping containers.

title.children: Philippines Typhoon Kalamaegi death toll rises above 50 in flooding rain

image.altText: A mobile icon of the Reddit app.

props.synopsis: Reddit and Kick will be included in the world-first social media ban for children under 16, which begins next month.

title.children: Reddit and Kick added to child social media ban

image.altText: A man dressed in a suit leans out of a car window.

props.synopsis: Widely regarded as one of the most influential vice-presidents in history, Mr Cheney was a driving force behind the US invasion of Iraq in 2003.

title.children: Former US vice-president Dick Cheney dies aged 84

image.altText: A large US flag hangs on the side of an old building, which is the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE).

props.synopsis: Analysts say recent Wall Street activity shows pockets of global money markets are coming under strain. It has got some people worried the world could be heading towards another global credit crunch.

title.children: Market on 'high alert' as US economy shows signs of stress

image.altText: Jane Hume

props.synopsis: Jane Hume says comments from some Coalition MPs conflating late-term abortions with new laws that will extend paid leave to women who suffer stillbirths are an "unnecessary distraction". Follow live.

title.children: Liberal senator calls stillbirth leave remarks 'unnecessary distraction'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Liberals should clear net zero air by Christmas: McCormack
'We will not leave any stone unturned,' Ayres says of Tomago smelter
Comments from Coalition MPs an 'unnecessary distraction', Hume says

image.altText: A tattered missing person poster with a young man smiling on a telegraph pole.

props.synopsis: New York political candidate Petros Krommidas went missing at a beach five months ago, but he could still win a seat in Nassau County.

title.children: New York political candidate who vanished five months ago could still win

image.altText: A weather radar being displayed on a phone, in front of a different radar on a computer screen

props.synopsis: Tender documents and sources show the Bureau of Meteorology's new website may have cost between $78m and $150m — much higher than initially reported.

title.children: BOM website questions intensify over true cost of redesign

image.altText: Elon Musk holding his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: Norway's sovereign wealth fund says it will vote against ratifying Tesla chief executive Elon Musk's proposed compensation package, which is potentially worth $US1 trillion.

title.children: Major Tesla shareholder to vote against Musk's $1.5 trillion pay deal

image.altText: David Beckham holding a King's Birthday Honours medal.

props.synopsis: The world-famous footballer was handed the honour, for services to sport and charity, at a ceremony at Windsor Castle.

title.children: David Beckham receives knighthood in 'big moment' for ex-footballer

image.altText: A plate with a smattering of green beans and beef Wellington, and a knife and fork.

props.synopsis: Intermittent fasting can have health benefits, but does being hungry affect our cognitive abilities? Here's what all the evidence tells us.

title.children: Does fasting dull your mental edge? We crunched the data for the best advice

image.altText: A mine site near a road and bushland, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: The future of a NSW coal mine remains unclear after its holding company entered administration, with the mine owing more than $100 million in outstanding debt, including almost $30 million in unpaid royalties.

title.children: Administrators called in for owner of mine owing almost $30m in royalties

image.altText: Jamie Kah smiles, in jockey outfit as she rides a horse at Flemington Racecourse.

props.synopsis: When eight-year-old Jamie started riding lessons on her little pony named Bessie, she hoped she would one day win the coveted Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Why Jamie Melham's Melbourne Cup win was 'like a fairytale come true'

image.altText: Black-and-white picture of Ben Aulich.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has found a Canberra woman was unfairly stripped of the value of her shares in two companies founded by former lawyer Ben Aulich, awarding her $500,000 in compensation.

title.children: Judge rules Canberra woman entitled to $500k after share dispute

image.altText: A woman leaning on the front of a car, parked in a busy street

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says schemes to help grow its electric charger network have been "fully contracted" with "no additional funding committed", leaving it to towns, roadhouses and accommodation providers to fill the gap.

title.children: Mining towns, tourists left without EV chargers on key inland routes

image.altText: Two men in CCTV footage.

props.synopsis: Police have released images of two men alleged to have spray painted antisemitic graffiti at eight locations in Melbourne earlier this year.

title.children: Men wanted over antisemitic graffiti in Melbourne

image.altText: A younger woman and an older woman hold a framed photograph of Bruce and Margaret.

props.synopsis: Bruce Drabsch's daughter Melinda Dagger, who was travelling to hospital to be with her ailing father, was phoned by a doctor and asked to inform her mother her husband of more than six decades had died, because no Auslan interpreter was provided.

title.children: Deaf couple 'effectively unable to be involved in care decisions' before man's death

image.altText: hail damaged house window

props.synopsis: After being smashed by giant hail, south-east Queensland residents are being warned to be aware.

title.children: Storm-hit residents warned to watch out for 'disaster chasers'

image.altText: Scott Riley stands next to a road in Queenstown

props.synopsis: A regional Tasmanian council has lost nearly a third of its staff, with the union representing staff putting the council "on notice" to address a number of issues.

title.children: General manager defends West Coast Council amid staff exodus

image.altText: A close up of a newborn baby's ear and fingers.

props.synopsis: Thousands of babies are born at the Toowoomba Base Hospital each year, but some women say they are scared to give birth there.

title.children: Two obstetrics directors resign and senior midwives on leave in SEQ hospital

image.altText: Uniformed Thai soldiers escort people out of security vehicles.

props.synopsis: A Shenzhen court has sentenced five people to death for their involvement in a violent criminal gang with fraud operations in Myanmar, Chinese state media says.

title.children: Five sentenced to death in China for role in Myanmar scam centres

image.altText: Lachlan Galvin of the Bulldogs is tackled, holding the football in one hand while standing

props.synopsis: NRL clubs are set to be put on notice and told they can no longer publicly declare interest in a player at a rival team unless the target is off contract.

title.children: NRL launches new anti-tampering rules in wake of Galvin saga

image.altText: An aeroplane looks microscopic when silhouetted by a supermoon.

props.synopsis: The difference from other full moons won't be all that noticeable to the naked eye, but you can enhance the viewing experience if you pick the right time and vantage point.

title.children: The 'beaver' full moon will be the the closest supermoon of the year. Here's how to see it

image.altText: A generic image of a red Australian rules ball.

props.synopsis: A suburban Perth football club is suspended from its league for two years after a "severe breach" of integrity standards, following an end-of-season costume stunt that left City of Stirling workers distressed.

title.children: Stephen Hawking costume sees Perth football club banned for two years
